definition: gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Buddha Gate disciples have been the beneficiaries.
sentences.chinese: 佛门寺的弟子们皆是受益者。

sentences.english: Crazy English founder Li Yang has converted to Buddhism.
sentences.chinese: 疯狂英语的创始人李阳皈依了佛门。

sentences.english: Following the upgrade, any standard Gateway can be selected to quickly transform into a Warpgate.
sentences.chinese: 升级往后，任何原空间门可以采选调换成时佛门。

sentences.english: The magnificent Longmen Grottoes are ancient sculptures priceless to Buddhists.
sentences.chinese: 气势雄伟的龙门石窟，是佛门珍贵的古代雕刻艺术。

definition: Dharma (the teachings of the Buddha)/Buddhist doctrine
the Shaolin monastery and martial arts school
Mahayana, the Great Vehicle/Buddhism based on the Mayahana sutras, as spread to Central Asia, China and beyond/also pr. [Da4 cheng2]
to greet and usher in (guests, newcomers etc)/(Buddhism) to receive into the Pure Land
poor monk (humble term used by monk of himself)
